p: Overall, across all regions of the GIHSN, influenza B/Yamagata-like virus (26.1% of influenza-positive patients) and influenza A/H3N2 (25.6%) were the most frequently detected strains, closely followed by A/H1N1pdm09 (21.1%). Influenza B/Victoria-like virus was detected in 2.3% of influenza-positive patients, unsubtyped influenza A virus in 12.2%, and influenza B of unknown lineage in 12.7%. Except in Mexico and South Africa, influenza B/Yamagata-like was the dominant B lineage detected in all countries where lineage was determined.
